title: I'm in Korea but from NA, what servers can I switch to that I will have decent ping?
body: I recently moved to Korea for my first duty station. US Armed forces, and obviously I can't play on Korean or NA servers. SO I tried to switch to Japan's servers but due to my location I wasn't accepted into their servers. Is there another server I could join that would allow me to play?? I get 400 ping on NA servers from Korea, so I'm kinda desperate.

replies.body:
Are you looking to transfer your account or create an entirely new one? Accounts from NA can only be transferred to specific servers, which are listed in [this guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751924-Account-Transfer-FAQ)

Let me know if you have any questions.

I would like to temporarily switch servers while I'm stationed in Korea. I attempted to switch to Japanese servers, which I did successfully but since my location is in Korea they have restrictions that don't allow people not actually in Japan to play on their servers. I just need to know which servers I am actually eligible to play on from Korea and what the ping may be like before I pay to switch again. I'd rather not put my account into limbo again between two servers. Thank you for responding.

The only other Riot-controlled region in the area that you could transfer to would be Oceania. I'd recommend running a tracer test using [this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) for the *OCE Server* and pasting the results here so we can check out your latency to the server.

Here you go.

So it looks like your connection to the Oceania servers should be around 200ms if you transfer. It's certainly not ideal, but it's definitely playable. I've got some mates on Oceania that I play with and I get about the same latency (~200ms) and I can still contribute and play the game.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Help this man get on the servers please, brave dude serving our country and going to Korea to do it, help him out
Thank you for your support, it means the world to me. People like yourself are the reason I enlisted in the first place.
